author: Coingape Staff
title: XRP Price Prediction: Expert Sees Potential Surge to $3.70
text: Ripple XRP coin is currently in the spotlight following an expert‚Äôs analysis suggesting a potential surge in its value. Amid its ongoing consolidation phase, Ripple is showing signs that could lead to a significant increase in its price, possibly reaching $3.70. Currently [valued](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/xrp/) at $0.63, XRP is experiencing a consolidation phase along a slanted trend line. This pattern is reminiscent of previous cycles where the asset showed significant growth following similar trends. In 2021, XRP witnessed a 500% gain, reaching $1.60. This historical precedent and current market conditions form the basis of the expert‚Äôs prediction for a potential surge. [#XRP]Super Guppy (Update) üîç Latest Development Check: For a clearer picture, refer to the October 28, 2022 post: [https://t.co/WPLTtxRvov] What's Happening Now: [#XRP]is currently in a consolidation phase along a slanted trend line, reminiscent of cycle 'B'. The pattern mirrors‚Ä¶ [pic.twitter.com/Uz3aHf4mR6] Recommended Articles ‚Äî EGRAG CRYPTO (@egragcrypto) [December 26, 2023] Technical analysis retrieved from TradingView indicates a strong bullish market sentiment. The summary aligns with a ‚Äòstrong buy‚Äô rating, supported by moving averages and oscillators. Ripple‚Äôs trading volume has surged by 38%, now standing at $1.9 billion, further reinforcing the positive outlook. Additionally, the [appearance](https://twitter.com/egragcrypto/status/1585847672854175745) of a glowing green Super Guppy, a set of moving averages indicating trend strength, suggests a bullish trend for XRP. XRP Legal Clarity and Market Anticipation Following Ripple‚Äôs partial victory in the case [against](https://coingape.com/xrp-lawsuit-ripple-legal-chief-us-sec-settlement/) the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), where XRP was declared not a security, market anticipation has grown. Despite this legal clarity, XRP has not yet seen a formidable rally in line with the general market movement. However, experts believe the asset is well-positioned for growth, especially when considering Ripple‚Äôs underlying technology and increasing adoption rates. Ripple Price Prediction The expert, known under the pseudonym Egrag Crypto, suggests that the period between December 2023 and February 2024 could be critical for XRP. This timeframe is expected to witness significant price movements, offering potential opportunities for investors. The analysis advises consolidating dollars and other crypto gains into XRP during this phase, which could amplify portfolios by six to seven times. XRP‚Äôs race to hit the $1 mark is also in context with competing assets like Cardano (ADA). Based on underlying factors and technical indicators it is considered to have a strong position in this race. The overall trajectory along with the [market](https://coingape.com/markets/xrp-price-prediction-simmers-at-0-64-can-december-uncork-festive-flow-towards-1/) trends and technology adoption rates, will be key determinants in its potential skyrocketing prospects. XRP/USD daily price chart, Source: [Tradingview](https://www.tradingview.com/x/EAv8su1G/) A look at the Ripple‚Äôs technical analysis obtained from TradingView reveals that optimistic sentiments dominate, with the summary coinciding with a strong buy‚Äô at 13. Moving averages support the same rating of 11 and oscillators support a ‚Äòbuy‚Äô at 2. The 20-EMA is currently above 50-EMA, indicating a bullish trend in the near term. author: @eldeber
title: Efra√≠n Su√°rez ser√° investigado por la presunta firma falsificada de Camacho | El Deber
text: Efra√≠n Su√°rez ser√° investigado por usurpaci√≥n de funciones La defensa de Su√°rez manifest√≥ que no existen elementos probatorios para ampliar la denuncia del caso contra el ex asesor. La petici√≥n fue realizada por los abogados de la Gobernaci√≥n La Unidad de Anticorrupci√≥n de la Fiscal√≠a de Santa Cruz confirm√≥ que Efra√≠n Su√°rez, ex asesor de Gesti√≥n de la Gobernaci√≥n cruce√±a, pas√≥ de calidad de testigo a calidad de investigado en el caso de la presunta [firma falsificada del gobernador Luis Fernando Camacho](https://eldeber.com.bo/santa-cruz/notifican-a-camacho-en-el-caso-de-supuesta-falsificacion-de-firma-en-documento-oficial-desde-la-carc_368803). Yolanda Aguilera, fiscal anticorrupci√≥n, inform√≥ sobre la ampliaci√≥n de la denuncia contra Su√°rez. Efra√≠n ocupa actualmente la vicepresidencia de la alianza Creemos. La solicitud de ampliaci√≥n que facilita el paso de testigo a investigado fue presentada por los abogados de la actual administraci√≥n del ente departamental del gobernador en suplencia, [ Mario Aguilera](https://eldeber.com.bo/santa-cruz/descartan-viaje-del-gobernador-en-ejercicio-mario-aguilera-al-exterior_370884). ‚ÄúInicialmente se observ√≥ la denuncia, luego ya que fue subsanada y se emiti√≥ la ampliaci√≥n de la investigaci√≥n por un presunto delito de usurpaci√≥n de funciones en contra del se√±or Efra√≠n Su√°rez. Vamos a recabar los elementos investigativos y luego veremos a cu√°l adec√∫a su conducta‚Äù, inform√≥ Aguilera. La denuncia fue interpuesta por el Viceministerio de Transparencia, a la que se adhiri√≥ la Gobernaci√≥n cruce√±a. En la misma, se acusa a una funcionaria de la Secretar√≠a de Justicia de haber falsificado la firma de la primera autoridad departamental, cuando √©sta se encuentra recluida en Chonchocoro de La Paz. La acusaci√≥n tambi√©n alcanz√≥ a Camacho. Tanto el gobernador cruce√±o como la notaria son acusados por los presuntos delitos de falsedad ideol√≥gica y falsedad material. La fiscal Aguilera se√±al√≥ que se notificar√° al juez de la causa y en la pr√≥xima semana se prev√© que el ex asesor de la Gobernaci√≥n sea convocado a declarar. Cuestionan proceso En mayo, Efra√≠n Su√°rez acudi√≥ al Departamento Especializado de Lucha Contra la Corrupci√≥n (Delcc) de la Fuerza Especial de Lucha Contra el Crimen (Felcc) para brindar su declaraci√≥n en calidad de testigo. En aquella ocasi√≥n, manifest√≥ que el proceso responde a m√≥viles pol√≠ticos por parte del Gobierno de continuar con la persecuci√≥n contra Luis Fernando Camacho y que ha utilizado a Mario Aguilera para continuar en ese fin. ‚ÄúEs imposible que el gobernador falsifique su propia firma, argumentan que podr√≠a ser otra persona la que falsific√≥ la firma del gobernador y eso se desvirt√∫a f√°cilmente. El impulso procesal que se le est√° dando no trata de llegar a la verdad de los hechos. Es un proceso tirado de los pelos‚Äù, expres√≥. En contacto con EL DEBER, el abogado Mart√≠n Camacho, que patrocina a Su√°rez, asegur√≥ que jur√≠dicamente no existen elementos para la ampliaci√≥n y mucho menos para que en etapa preliminar se demuestra una probabilidad de autor√≠a en ninguno de los delitos penales. ‚ÄúLa denuncia es una primera fase, dentro de la etapa preliminar el Ministerio P√∫blico podr√° considerar el rechazo de esta denuncia ampliada en contra del doctor Su√°rez y tambi√©n gobernador‚Äù, opin√≥ el jurista.

title: Budget europ√©en : pourquoi Ursula von der Leyen affronte une mutinerie in√©dite
text:
--> U rsula von der Leyen pensait sans doute marquer l'histoire avec sa proposition de budget europ√©en pour 2028-2034. Elle risque effectivement de la marquer, mais pas comme elle l'esp√©rait. Sa proposition de cadre financier pluriannuel (CFP) ‚Äì le budget europ√©en sur sept ans ‚Äì de 2 000 milliards d'euros suscite une lev√©e de boucliers du Parlement europ√©en et des agriculteurs, d√©j√† mobilis√©s au pied du si√®ge de la Commission, √† Bruxelles. Une mutinerie d'autant plus cuisante qu'elle est men√©e par son propre camp politique, le PPE (Parti populaire europ√©en), qui lui a confi√© les cl√©s de ce deuxi√®me mandat.
Dans une d√©claration commune cinglante, les quatre principaux groupes politiques du Parlement europ√©en ‚Äì PPE, les sociaux-d√©mocrates, les lib√©raux-centristes de Renew et m√™me les √©cologiste...

Enfin, on s‚Äôest fait souffler des stocks de masques sur le tarmac dans a√©roport par une √©quipe de Basket US, parce qu‚Äôils restaient n√©gociables jusqu‚Äô√† l‚Äôembarquement.

author: @KSLA
title: Champion racehorse, leading sire Uncle Mo euthanized following leg injury
text:
RELATED VIDEO -- Keeneland‚Äôs yearling sale became the highest-grossing thoroughbred auction in the world this past September. (Source: WKYT) By Jordan Gartner Published: Dec. 19, 2024 at 3:06 PM CST | Updated: 36 minutes ago Email This Link
Share on Facebook
Share on X (formerly Twitter)
Share on Pinterest
Share on LinkedIn
VERSAILLES, Ky. (Gray News) - The thoroughbred industry suffered a great loss this week with the death of champion horse Uncle Mo .
Mike Repole, Uncle Mo‚Äôs owner, shared that his stallion was euthanized on Thursday following a left foreleg injury.
The Repole Stable said the 16-year-old thoroughbred underwent surgery for the injury the day before, but the recovery process was too much for him to endure.
FILE - In this May 5, 2011, file photo, exercise rider Hector Ramos takes Kentucky Derby entrant Uncle Mo for a workout at Churchill Downs in Louisville, Ky. ‚ÄúThe Repole Stable family, Todd Pletcher family and the entire Coolmore family are heartbroken,‚Äù the Repole family shared. ‚ÄúUncle Mo was so much more to me than a champion and iconic stallion - he was and always will be a part of my family.‚Äù
Uncle Mo was bred in Kentucky and was the son of multiple graded stakes winner Indian Charlie.
Todd Pletcher trained Uncle Mo over his racing career while being ridden by John Velazquez. The multiple-stakes winning runner finished his career with five wins in eight starts, including a dominating win in the 2010 Breeders‚Äô Cup Juvenile , while earning more than $1.5 million.
Uncle Mo retired to Coolmore‚Äôs Ashford Stud after his racing career, where he went on to sire nearly 900 winners who have earned more than $120 million.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre all still in shock,‚Äù Coolmore America‚Äôs Dermot Ryan said. ‚ÄúHe will be greatly missed. He was an exceptional sire on the racetrack and in the sales ring.‚Äù
Repole added, ‚ÄúThank you Uncle Mo for fulfilling my childhood dreams of owning a special racehorse.‚Äù
Copyright 2024 Gray Local Media, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: R√©seau International
title: Israel's Starvation Strategy
text: by mike whitney ¬´It is no coincidence that the attacks on UNRWA took place after the ICJ ruling. Israel is trying to discredit the International Court of Justice, and one way to do this is to denigrate the UNWRA. But the UNWRA has played a heroic role in providing health, education and other services to Palestinian refugees since 1948. It is truly heartbreaking that Israeli propaganda now demonizes the UNWRA and leads some countries to cut off their aid. My sympathy and support therefore go entirely to the UNWRA, and I hope that it can continue for a long time to play the vital role it has always played in supporting the Palestinian victims of Israeli aggression.'. ( [Avi Shlaim](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_cQ7b03ggCI), Israeli historian, YouTube) UNRWA ensures the distribution of food and flour to all of Gaza's 2,2 million inhabitants. Defunding UNRWA will lead to mass starvation and death. Here is your Zionist quiz of the day: Why did Israel launch a veritable media blitz on a United Nations relief agency (UNRWA) on the same day that the International Criminal Court (ICC) delivered its historic judgment on the genocide? - To distract from the fact that Israel is committing genocide in Gaza - Inform the public that new information has come to light regarding Hamas' involvement in the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA). - Assuring citizens around the world that Israel's primary concern is the fight against terrorism. - activate the final phase of their ethnic cleansing operation. If you answered ‚Äú4,‚Äù pat yourself on the back because that‚Äôs the correct answer. Of course, it is also true that Israel wanted to distract from the ICJ's announcement, but that pales in comparison to launching the final phase of its ethnic cleansing operation. This is the real coup de grace, the final blow to the two-state solution and a practical remedy to Israel's nagging demographic problem. It is also the essential piece of the puzzle that makes sense of the past 100-plus days of relentless bombings, airstrikes and other forms of state terror. It is as if Israel is boldly laying down its cards so that the whole world can see the strategy it intends to employ to eradicate the indigenous population and realize the Zionist dream of a Jewish state from the river to the sea. And what could this strategy be? Disperse 2 million Palestinians around the world through massive immigration. But how will they do it? After all, haven't a number of countries already refused to welcome Palestinians? Indeed, they did, but that was before photos (soon to be released) of starving women and children flooded social media sites around the world, sparking an unprecedented outpouring of sympathy for the besieged population. And as public sympathy leads to widespread outrage, more and more people will demand that their governments take action to alleviate suffering through mass immigration. This is how Israel intends to get rid of its indigenous population and create Zionist Valhalla, a Jewish majority in perpetuity. This is why Israel launched its ferocious attack on the UNWRA, because the UNWRA ‚Äì more than any other humanitarian organization operating in the Middle East ‚Äì helps feed and house the Palestinians, which goes against the Israel's explicit intentions. The last thing Israel wants is for the Palestinians to establish a huge refugee camp near Rafah, which will continue to grow in size in the years to come. This phenomenon has already occurred in Jordan and Lebanon, where nearly 3 million Palestinians still languish in refugee camps (75 years after the establishment of the Israeli state) and are still determined to return home one day or the other. This is not what Israel wants. Israel wants the Palestinians to ‚Äúvanish into thin air,‚Äù which is why it wants them scattered all over the world so that the very idea of returning home will never cross their minds. Thus, although Israeli leaders are not happy about the reputational damage caused by their treatment of the Palestinians, they are willing to endure it in order to achieve their broader strategic goals, namely the complete eradication of Arab population and the strengthening of a permanent Jewish majority. Israel's overall strategy was best summed up by Daniella Weiss, a former mayor of a West Bank settlement, who said the following in a brief interview on TikTok: ¬´They will move. They will move. The Arabs will move... So we don't give them food, we don't give the Arabs anything, and they will have to leave. The world will accept them'. ( [Middle East Eye](https://www.tiktok.com/@middleeasteye/video/7329510232520936737), Tik Tok) This is Israel's plan in a nutshell. source: [The Unz Review](https://www.unz.com/mwhitney/israels-starvation-strategy/) translation [R√©seau International](https://en.reseauinternational.net/)

author: PTI
title: Turkey reportedly detains 32 IS militants and foils possible attacks on synagogues and churches | Law-Order
text: Turkey reportedly detains 32 IS militants and foils possible attacks on synagogues and churches [PTI](/pti-stories)| Ankara | Updated: 29-12-2023 15:32 IST | Created: 29-12-2023 15:16 IST - Country: - Turkey Turkish security forces have detained 32 people suspected of links to the Islamic State extremist group who were allegedly planning to carry out attacks on synagogues and churches as well as the Iraqi Embassy, Turkey's state-run news agency reported Friday. The suspects, including three alleged senior IS militants, were detained in raids carried out at dawn in nine provinces across Turkey, Anadolu Agency reported, citing unnamed security sources. They were detained in a joint operation by the country's intelligence agency and police, the agency said. The arrests come a week after police rounded up 304 suspected IS militants in simultaneous raids across Turkey in what appeared to be a security sweep leading up to the New Year festivities. The Islamic State group has carried out a string of deadly attacks in Turkey, including a shooting at an Istanbul night club on January 1, 2017, that killed 39 people during New Year celebrations. (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.) ALSO READ [Turkey says Somalia leader's son to participate in fatal car accident trial](/article/law-order/2745643-turkey-says-somalia-leaders-son-to-participate-in-fatal-car-accident-trial) [Turkey's Erdogan tells Biden U.S. has responsibility to secure Gaza ceasefire](/article/law-order/2746557-turkeys-erdogan-tells-biden-us-has-responsibility-to-secure-gaza-ceasefire) [Biden, Turkey's Erdogan spoke about Sweden's accession to NATO -White House](/article/politics/2746569-biden-turkeys-erdogan-spoke-about-swedens-accession-to-nato--white-house) [Turkey will no longer send imams to German mosques - German ministry](/article/politics/2745996-turkey-will-no-longer-send-imams-to-german-mosques---german-ministry) [Biden, Turkey's Erdogan spoke about Sweden's accession to NATO -White House](/article/politics/2746620-biden-turkeys-erdogan-spoke-about-swedens-accession-to-nato--white-house)

author: @WNGdotorg
title: Nikki Haley faces backlash for Civil War gaffe | WORLD
text: Nikki Haley faces backlash for Civil War gaffe Critics slammed former UN Ambassador Nikki Haley for not mentioning slavery as a cause in the Civil War during a town hall in New Hampshire Wednesday night. Haley said that the cause of the war ‚Äúalways comes down to the role of government and what the rights of the people are.‚Äù The voter asking the question noted his surprise she didn‚Äôt name slavery, to which Haley responded, ‚ÄúWhat do you want me to say about slavery?‚Äù Haley clarified her comments during a Thursday morning radio interview with Jack Heath, saying she wanted to get at the bigger lesson from the war. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm from the South,‚Äù she said, ‚ÄúOf course I know it‚Äôs about slavery.‚Äù What criticism is she facing? Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis‚Äô team re-posted the town hall clip to social media with the comment ‚ÄúYikes.‚Äù DeSantis was in Iowa campaigning on Thursday and claimed that Haley ‚Äúhas had some problems with some basic American history.‚Äù The pair are competing to be the Republican party's alternative candidate to front-runner former President Donald Trump. The latest Quinnipiac University poll [showed](https://poll.qu.edu/poll-release?releaseid=3887) Haley and DeSantis tied for second, each grabbing an estimated 11 percent of GOP support. Dig deeper: [Read](https://wng.org/roundups/warm-up-acts-1701924192) Leo Briceno and Carolina Lumetta‚Äôs report in The Stew on the latest GOP primary debate. If you enjoyed this article and would like to support WORLD's brand of Biblically sound journalism, [click here](https://give.wng.org/). An actual newsletter worth subscribing to instead of just a collection of links. ‚ÄîAdam [Sign up to receive The Sift email newsletter each weekday morning for the latest headlines from WORLD‚Äôs breaking news team.](/the-sift)

author: Jamie Oehlers
title: Jamie Oehlers Quartet @ The Ellington , The Ellington Jazz Club - Perth, 29 December 2023
text:
Advertisement Come and experience the final This is Jazz for 2023!
This show features Jamie Oehlers, Harry Mitchell, Zac Grafton and Ben Vanderwal.
Jamie Oehlers is one of Australia‚Äôs leading jazz artists and saxophonists. In 2003 Jamie was the winner of the World Saxophone Competition at the Montreux Jazz Festival in Switzerland and has won numerous awards in Australia, including an Australian Jazz ‚ÄúBell‚Äù Award for Best Australian Jazz Artist and three for Best Contemporary Jazz Album, an ABC Limelight Award for Best Jazz CD Release, an Australian Young Achiever of the Year Award, and has twice been a finalist in the ARIA awards for Best Jazz Album. He has performed throughout the world including major festivals like the JVC Jazz Festival in New York, BBC London Jazz Festival, Jazz Yatra in India, Montreux Jazz Festival in Switzerland, Edinburgh Jazz Festival, Villa Celimontana Jazz Festival in Rome, Galway Jazz festival, Brecon Jazz Festival, and comprehensively throughout Asia, Australia and New Zealand. He has collaborated with many great international jazz artists within Australia and overseas including performances and recordings with Ari Hoenig, Aaron Goldberg, George Garzone, Charlie Haden, Eric Harland, Reuben Rogers, Rufus Reid, Geri Allen, Cindy Blackman, Jamie Cullum, Bob Hurst, Megan Washington, Kate Ceberano and many more. Jamie has released 13 CDs as a leader, including his most recent recordings ‚ÄúNight Music‚Äù, ‚ÄúInnocent Dreamer‚Äù (with Tal Cohen), ‚ÄúThe Burden of Memory‚Äù (with Paul Grabowsky, Eric Harland and Reuben Rogers), and ‚ÄúSmoke and Mirrors‚Äù (with Ari Hoenig). Advertisement Event Venue & Nearby Stays The Ellington Jazz Club - Perth, 191 Beaufort Street,Perth,WA,Australia

author: Rohit Singh; Skymet Weather Team
title: Heavy Rains Lash Tamil Nadu, Respite Likely Soon
text:
On the predicted lines, many parts of Tamil Nadu were lashed with heavy to very heavy rains in the past 24 hours. In addition to the coastline, the heavy rains extended to reach the interiors and the hilly resorts like Ooty and Kodaikanal, as well. Good rains battered some parts of Kerala and the union territory of Puducherry and Karaikal. Some respite is likely over the next two days, on 14th and 15thDec2024.
In the past 24 hours, the state capital observatory at Meenambakkam recorded 106mm rainfall. The heaviest rainfall along the coastline was at Karaikal, registering a deluge of 203mm, till today morning and the rains still continue. Over 100mm of rainfall was recorded at Tiruttani, Nagappattinam, Parangipettai and Kodaikanal. The weather activity will reduce today and will remain confined to the central parts of the coastline and interiors of Tamil Nadu, bordering the Kerala region.
The well-marked low-pressure area is now lying over the Gulf of Mannar and Comorin region. It will move further westward to Lakshadweep and the Maldives region. The system will weaken over the next 24 hours. Therefore, the weather intensity and spread will decrease substantially for about 48 hours, between 14th and 15th Dec. Today, heavy rainfall is likely over Pamban, Tondi, Tuticorin, Nagappattinam and adjoining parts. This activity will also ease out tonight and in the wee hours tomorrow.
However, the respite is likely to be short and sweet. Another weather system, very close to the heels of the current one, is following and moving east to west. A cyclonic circulation is marked over the Southeast Bay of Bengal and South Andaman Sea. This will reach central parts of South Bay tomorrow and in the proximity of eastern coast of Sri Lanka, a day later on 15th Dec 2024. Another wave of heavy weather activity is likely for the state of Tamil Nadu, more so the central region of the coast, on 16th and 17th Dec 2024. The state capital Chennai also remains within reach of intense weather and there need to exercise caution.

author: efe
title: 1-1: A Las Palmas se le escapa el triunfo y sigue sin ganar en pretemporada
text: La UD Las Palmas y el Granada CF igualaron en partido amistoso disputado este jueves en Marbella (1-1), con un primer tiempo dominado por el equipo amarillo, en el que anot√≥ su gol tras un error del guardameta Marc Mart√≠nez, y un segundo periodo m√°s igualado, donde el cuadro nazar√≠ acab√≥ empatando el choque en el minuto 89. El conjunto isle√±o fue superior en la primera mitad, ejerciendo una presi√≥n alta y llegando con mucha frecuencia al √°rea rival, con especial aportaci√≥n de Alberto Moleiro entre l√≠neas, y de Marvin Park, muy profundo por el carril derecho, desde su posici√≥n de lateral. Un zurdazo de Peji√±o que se estrell√≥ en el poste y una llegada de Park con disparo desviado fueron las ocasiones m√°s claras de los amarillos en los primeros diez minutos, en los que atosig√≥ a su rival. El gol, sin embargo, lleg√≥ de la forma m√°s insospechada, cuando en un pase atr√°s, el guardameta Marc Mart√≠nez no quiso controlar el bal√≥n y lo dej√≥ correr hacia su porter√≠a, y cuando ya se colaba, lo intent√≥ despejar con el pie, pero C√©dric acompa√±√≥ la acci√≥n e intercept√≥ su intento sobre la l√≠nea de meta para impulsar la pelota a la red. El Granada, con un sistema 1-4-4-2 bien definido, apenas cre√≥ peligro en la primera parte, en la que Cillessen se lanz√≥ a los pies de Uzuni en el minuto 36 en la √∫nica aproximaci√≥n con cierto peligro. Antes del descanso, Javi Mu√±oz pudo aumentar la ventaja insular pero Marc Mart√≠nez rechaz√≥ con la pierna derecha su disparo a bocajarro. Tras el descanso, Luis Carri√≥n cambi√≥ a todo el equipo amarillo, incluido al portero, pero sigui√≥ fiel a su dibujo 1-4-2-3-1, mientras que Guille Abascal inicialmente solo introdujo a Rodelas y Pablo S√°enz, y minutos m√°s tarde al resto de jugadores. Uno de los incorporados en el Granada, el portero Luca Zidane, protagoniz√≥ una gran parada en el minuto 80 en un disparo de Sandro dentro del √°rea. En los instantes finales, el senegal√©s Faye conect√≥ un excelente cabezazo tras un centro desde la izquierda, adelant√°ndose a Enrique Clemente, e impidi√≥ la victoria de Las Palmas, que contin√∫a sin ganar en esta pretemporada despu√©s de tres partidos. UD Las Palmas: Cillessen; Marvin Park, Herzog, Mika M√°rmol, Benito; Javi Mu√±oz, Fabio; Peji√±o, Moleiro, Manu Fuster; y C√©dric. Al inicio del segundo tiempo jugaron Horkas; Viti, √Ålex Su√°rez, Enrique Clemente, Sinkgraven; Loiodice, Kirian; Marc Cardona, Iv√°n Gil, Sandro; y Mata. Granada CF: Marc Mart√≠nez; Ricard, Insua, Ignasi Miquel, Carlos Neva; Melendo, Gonzalo Villar, Sergio Ruiz, Jozwiak; Uzuni y Weissman. Tambi√©n jugaron Rodelas, Pablo S√°enz, Miguel Rubio, Rub√©n S√°nchez, Hongla, √ìscar, Brau, Faye y Luca Zidane. Goles: 1-0, min. 18: C√©dric. 1-1, min. 89: Faye. √Årbitro: Pablo Morales Moreno (Comit√© de Andaluc√≠a). Mostr√≥ tarjeta amarilla a Kirian, de la UD Las Palmas, por protestar con el partido ya terminado, y a Pablo S√°enz y Hongla, del Granada. Incidencias: partido amistoso disputado este jueves en las instalaciones del Marbella Football Center, en Marbella (M√°laga).
